titleStmt.title: Frank Catron et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG11503

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 45th, 47th, 48th, and 49th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Muster Rolls

body.p:
1. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6.
A. B. Culton com 2 Lieut 49" Infy Septr 1. 1863.
Head Quarters 49th Ky Vols
Camp Nelson Ky Sep 23rd 1863
To His Excellency
Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner A. B. Culton a citizen of Harlan County Kentucky has recruited a Company for the 49th Regt Ky Infy Vols -- he done so without having a commission as a recruiting officer. At the time that he commenced recruiting his Company (Viz on the 1st of June 1863) there was no mail communication any where near where he lived and that he did not know that ^it^ was necessary to have such commission, he recruited the Company in good faith. And has at this time Sixty one men at this Camp. and has several others recruited who have not yet reported -- We the undersigned request your Excellency to grant Mr Culton a Commission as 2nd Lieut dated from the 1st of June 1863 in order that he may receive pay for the service he has rendered in recruiting
Frank Catron Capt Co B 49th Ky vol

Philos Stratten
Major Com 49th Ky vols
S. Golden Capt Co (A.) 49th Ky vols
J. J. Black 1st Lt. Co,, (H) 49th Ky vol
Jesse Mattingly 1st Lt Co (G) 49th Ky Vols.

49 Infy
Lieut Colton
com. issd & deld
Septr 26. 1863
Refered to Adjt Genl for Coms Sept 26th 1863
